title: China to further improve business environment: spokesperson
content:
Photo taken on Jan. 2, 2021 shows the light show at the Lujiazui area in east China's Shanghai. (Xinhua/Wang Xiang)
BEIJING, March 4 (Xinhua) -- China will continue to build a business environment that is based on market principles, governed by law and up to international standards, a spokesperson for the annual session of the country's national legislature said Thursday.
The country will further advance institutional opening-up, promote the liberalization and facilitation of trade and investment, and achieve mutual benefits and common development with countries across the world, said Zhang Yesui, spokesperson for the fourth annual session of the 13th National People's Congress.
